programme.title: FWC 1990, Germany v Argentina
programme.desc: The world's most complete library of FIFA World Cup™ and FIFA Women's World Cup™ matches. Rewind football's greatest moments for free. Watch the full replay from the match between Germany FR and Argentina played at Stadio Olimpico, Rome on Sunday, 08 July 1990.

programme.title: 1990 Official Film, Soccer Shoot-Out
programme.desc: With humour, hairstyles, a pope who was once an aspiring goalkeeper and never,seen,before match footage, relive the captivating tale of the 1990 tournament. It included 'The Hand of God 2' from Diego Maradona, the eccentricity of Rene Higuita, the lovable cheek of Paul Gascoigne, the hip,wiggling of Roger Milla and an audacious attempt to divide Naples, while also recalling West Germany's dramatic victories over the Netherlands, England and Argentina en route to glory.

programme.title: ACADEMIES, In Youth We Trust
programme.desc: Who will be the next star to come out of the Anderlecht youth academy? And what sacrifices will it take for them to make it to first team? Rayane Bounida and the Agyei brothers, Enock and Eben, all share the same dream: making it to the first team at Anderlecht. The journey won't be easy, but through sacrifice and hard work even the wildest dreams can become a reality.

programme.title: GOLDEN BOOT, Müller
programme.desc: The 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ was a special tournament for a then 21,year,old Thomas Müller. The young Germany striker was able to score five goals for his side, on their way to a third place finish, earning him both the Golden Boot and Best Young Player awards.

programme.title: DISCOVERING, Hugo Sánchez

programme.title: Roman Catholic Church of the Name of Mary, Serbia
programme.desc: The Church of the Name of Mary is a Roman Catholic church from 1893-4. It replaces an old church from the 18th century, damaged during the Serbian uprising of 1849. The façade of this new neo-gothic church is made of yellow brick.

programme.title: Sidi Abo El Abbas Mosque
programme.desc: The Abu al-Abbas al-Mursi Mosque is an Egyptian mosque in the city of Alexandria. It is dedicated to the 13th century Murcian Andalusi Sufi saint Abul Abbas al Mursi, whose tomb it contains. It is located in the Anfoushi neighborhood of Alexandria, near t"& "he Citadel of Qaitbay.

programme.title: Capernaum Synagogue (White Synagogue)

programme.title: Hau Pagoda, Vietnam
programme.desc: Ho Chi Minh City, commonly known by its previous name, Saigon, is Vietnam&apos s largest and most populous City.Located in Ho Chi Minh City&apos s southern part is the splendid Thien Hau temple, one of the region&apos s most prominent cultural landmarks. Just a few kilometers away from the Thien Hau Pagoda is the City&apos s largest pagoda: the Xa Loi Pagoda.

programme.title: Smolenskaya Krepostnaya Stena, Russia
programme.desc: For many centuries, Smolensk served as a reliable defense of Russia&apos s capital, protecting many European neighbors&apos encroachments. That is why it was called the "shield city." One of the main symbols of the city&apos s defensive functions and a striking landmark that has survived this day is the Smolensk defensive wall. It was built at the end of the 16th century and was of great importance for defense in the Russian state. Smolensk has always played an important defensive role in history, so the Russian sovereigns took care of strengthening it. In the spring of 1554, a new, very high, wooden fortress was built by Ivan the Terrible&apos s order.

programme.title: Fort St. Angelo, Malta
programme.desc: The tip of one of the peninsulas surrounding the Grand Harbor inlet is, to this day, dominated by the imposing and spectacular Fort St. Angelo. Forti Sant'Anġlu, as the Maltese like to call it, sits at the tip of the Birgu or Vittoriosa peninsula. Enjoying a bird's eye view of the entire Grand Harbor it lies exactly at its midpoint

programme.title: Great Mosque of Kairouan, Tunisia
programme.desc: Located in the centre of Tunisia, between the mountains and the sea, here we are at Kairouan where we will discover the Great Mosque, considered the fourth holiest site in Islam after Mecca, Medina and Jerusalem. The Great Mosque of Kairouan was a public structure, set along roads that served a city with a vibrant commercial, educational, and religious life...

programme.title: Wat Ratchathammaram, Thailand
programme.desc: Wat Ratchathammaram, also known as the small Wat Sila Ngu temple, is situated at the top of Hua Thanon beach in the south of Koh Samui, Thailand. Apart from Wat Sila Ngu, Wat Ratchathammaram is also called the Snake Stone temple.

programme.title: Sassi di Matera, Italy
programme.desc: Between the toe and heel of Southern Italy, there is the Basilicata region. This mountainous and arid landscape of the area has ensured a relatively sparse population and only in recent years has local infrastructure been developed. One of the larger population centers in this remote area is the unique and spectacular City of Sassi di Matera.

programme.title: Saschiz Old Town, Romania
programme.desc: The villages of Saschiz, Mihai Viteazu, and Cloașterf make up the larger commune of Saschiz. First documented in the 14th century, Saschiz is known for its medieval fortress and church constructed by Transylvanian Saxons, a German speaker. Along with five other villages with fortified churches, Saschiz was inscribed on UNESCO's World Heritage sites in 1999.

programme.title: Arnad town, Aosta Valley, Italy
programme.desc: Arnad town in Aosta Valley is known for the production of the D.O.C Montjovet wine. The small medieval village stands on the banks of the Dora Baltea. programme.title: In The Cage (U/A +13)
programme.desc: (U/A +13) Marvin Fields is caught up with challenges and obstacles. On the verge of losing his family, he has to step up and face his adversaries. Marvin tries different avenues to help eliminate these difficulties, but his efforts are futile. Now, he decides to take desperate measures in saving his family and finances. When hell breaks loose and nothing seems to work, a true character is revealed through Marvin. Later on, Marvin discovers martial arts through his best friend Frank Biggs. This martial art will help Marvin find himself again and give him a sense of purpose. As he continues to search deeper his new found art, his troubles aren&apos t stagnant. Marvin still has to wake up and face the demons of his life. Marvin has got to get his life out of this never diminishing cage and find freedom. In the meantime, Claire Fields (Marvin&apos s wife) is fed up and tired of supporting the family. Marvin&apos s cage seems invisible to Claire, and this continues to trigger his frustration. In the end, true love and friendship will be revealed and seem to help break down the barriers around this mysterious cage.
